use prefix=$(LOCAL) for GnuPG libs so the *-config scripts work for building

The GnuPG projects (gpg-error, libassuan, gcrypt, etc.) use their own custom
*-config scripts that are something like pkg-config.  They are meant to be
installed before using, and don't handle cross-compiling well.  So we set
the prefix= to the full path where they exist on the build machine, then
the *-config scripts work for building.

Since Android doesn't use the rpath at all anyway, the shared libraries are
relocatable anyway, as long as LD_LIBRARY_PATH is set to point to where the
shared libraries are installed on the device.
include basic gnupg-for-java fixes from guardianproject/gnupg-for-java

make gnupg/gpgme ./configure use the full path of the programs they want to run

gnupg and gpgme both need to run various support programs like gpg, dirmngr,
etc.  They provide ./configure options for specifying the full path to
those programs.  Since we have to do weird prefix= tricks to get everything
to build, we need to specify the actuall installed path of these programs.

gpgme needs LD_LIBRARY_PATH set since it launches cmd line progs like gpg2

gpg2 is dynamically linked, and the only way in Android to find a dylib is
via the LD_LIBRARY_PATH.  Therefore, the gpg lib dir needs to be added
for gpgme env as well.

let the build tools set android:debuggable

From SDK Tools : ( SDK Tools, Revision 8 (December 2010) )

Support for a true debug build. Developers no longer need to add the
android:debuggable attribute to the <application> tag in the manifest â€” the
build tools add the attribute automatically. In Eclipse/ADT, all incremental
builds are assumed to be debug builds, so the tools insert
android:debuggable='true'. When exporting a signed release build, the tools do
not add the attribute. In Ant, a ant debug command automatically inserts the
android:debuggable='true' attribute, while ant release does not. If
android:debuggable='true' is manually set, then ant release will actually do a
debug build, rather than a release build.

make findProcessIdWithPIDOF() return first pid of multiple, rather than crash

'pidof' will return multiple pids if multiple processes are running, but
the code is all structured to handle a single pid. So at least only return
one pid, rather than just crash.
append GnuPG tools to Android Terminal Emulator's PATH

create app_gnupghome for apps to create their keyrings in

This folder is a writeable place for apps to create their GnuPG keyring
folders, i.e. GNUPGHOME.  Its not possible to make a shared keyring folder
because of the Android permissions model.  For a shared keyring, apps will
have to use the Intents or AIDL interfaces.

create aliases for all cmd line commands that auto-setup necessary env vars

GnuPG tools require a writeable HOME or GNUPGHOME to put the keyring in,
and the lib/ folder in LD_LIBRARY_PATH so the tools can find the needed
shared libraries.  These alias scripts just set up those env vars, so that
other apps can just call them directly and have a working command.

check the version of app_opt, and if needed upgrade it

Since it takes a while to unpack the whole app_opt tree, it should only
happen when its needed. So this patch adds a VERSION file that contains the
Android versionCode, so the app knows when it needs to upgrade app_opt or
not. The old version is currently renamed by adding a timestamp to the name
